Class UserBudget

java.lang.Object
budget.UserBudget
public class UserBudget extends Object
Manages user's budget, transactions, and provides summaries. Demonstrates arrays, method overloading, Math usage, encapsulation, static helpers.

    addTransaction(String type, double amount)

    • getMonthlyBudget

      public double getMonthlyBudget()

    • addTransaction

      public void addTransaction(String type, double amount)
      Overloaded addTransaction methods demonstrate method overloading: - one accepts type+amount (no description) - one accepts type+amount+description - one accepts a Transaction object directly

    • addTransaction

      public void addTransaction(String type, double amount, String description)

    • addTransaction

      public void addTransaction(Transaction t)

    • getTotalIncome

      public double getTotalIncome()

    • getTotalExpenses

      public double getTotalExpenses()

    • getRemaining

      public double getRemaining()
      Demonstrates Math class usage and arithmetic operators. remaining = monthlyBudget + totalIncome - totalExpenses

    • getAverageMonthlyExpense

      public double getAverageMonthlyExpense()
      Demonstrates use of a primitive array: calculate average monthly expense.

    • applyProcessingFee

      public double applyProcessingFee(double amount, double feePercent)
      Example method showing pass-by-value semantics: takes primitive and returns modified amount. Note: this doesn't mutate the caller's variable.

    • getSummary

      public String getSummary()
      Generates a multi-line formatted summary (uses ternary conditional operator).
